text: So i Disney PHD publishing also my Code a few years back (not yet Julia), and unwound say that for my applications (I have tenure and I applied for professorships this year) I got very positive feedback for contributing to OSS and publishing code that contains examples of the papers.

text: On topic: how did the, if I understand correctly, PhD supervisors know and evaluate your open-source contributions? They also had programming experience?

elements.text: On topic: how did the, if I understand correctly, PhD supervisors know and evaluate your open-source contributions? They also had programming experience?

text: For my PhD it was not part of the evaluation. I just published it (first sent it to the Wolfram Library of Mathematica Packages, lates published it on GitHub). For my habilitation (comparable to the second Doctor in Ruassia or lecturer) it was acknowledged and nice. For my recent application (I got the Job!) it was remarked as a very positive point.
